channel.title: Consensus on Programming Philosophy
channel.description: Recent content in Consensus on Programming Philosophy

item.title: With a little help from my friends…
item.description: Consensus building in Computes. Photo by Sidharth Bhatia on Unsplash Sometimes you want to make sure your tasks create a consistent result before trusting the outcome. We’ve added a simple consensus mechanism in Computes. When used, you can set a threshold of how many matches are required. Let’s look at an example task with a consensus threshold of 2. This means 2 tasks would have to agree on the results before they become visible in your dataset.
